H0.text: The vestibular system enters the brain stem and influences activity in the cerebellum, spinal cord, and cerebral cortex.

H1.text: The vasculature system enters the brain stem and influences activity in the cerebellum, spinal cord, and cerebral cortex.

H2.text: Ventricular system is the system that enters the brain stem and influences activity in the cerebellum, spinal cord, and cerebral cortex.

H3.text: The lipids system enters the brain stem and influences activity in the cerebellum, spinal cord, and cerebral cortex.

A4.text: Signals from the vestibular system also project to the cerebellum (where they are used to keep the VOR effective, a task usually referred to as learning or adaptation) and to different areas in the cortex.

A5.text: Signals sent to the spinal cord allow quick reflex reactions to both the limbs and trunk to regain balance.
